description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73) for the variation of condition 2 (Approved Plans) of planning permission ref: PP/2012/3064 dated 15/04/2015 for 'construction of three storey rear extension to provide extensions to existing retail shops (Use Class A1) at ground floor level and 8 residential units (4 x 2 bedroom flats and 4 x 1 bedroom flats) at first and second floor level with access fronting onto Hammond Road'. Variation to internal and external alterations including altered entrance to residential units, rear elevation design, and incorporation of first and second floor terraces
decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) L(00)04Rev.G, L(00)05Rev.G, L(00)06Rev.G, L(00)07Rev.G, L(00)08Rev.G & L(00)09Rev.G received 02/02/2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.4 of the Draft Development Management, Development Plan Document; policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012).
| The new residential unit hereby permitted shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes standards prior to their first occupation and shall be retained as such thereafter.
Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.4 of the Draft Development Management, Development Plan Document; policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012).
| The proposed works shall be completed in compliance with the noise mitigation measures approved under PP/2015/6592 dated 21/03/2016.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of occupants of the proposed residential units, and in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); the advice contained within the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 10: 'Noise and Vibration'; policy 7.15 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| The approved cycle and refuse/recycling storage shall be implemented and kept as approved for use by the occupants of the flats and thereafter permanently retained for their use.

Reason: To encourage green modes of transport and reduce the development's impact on the public highway and provide adequate refuse/recycling provision, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) (2004); policies 5.15, 5.16, 6.3, and 6.9 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original planning permission ref: PP/2012/3064 dated 15/04/2015.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority for the [floor][ceiling][walls] separating the commercial part(s) of the premises from dwellings, before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that they are resistant to the passage of smoke, fumes and odours and that the insulation is sufficient to prevent noise disturbance.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of occupants of the proposed residential units, and in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); the advice contained within the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 10: 'Noise and Vibration'; policy 7.15 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
